thread.title: Huge fire at a recycling centre in Stoke catches fire | Daily Mail Online
thread.title_full: Huge fire at a recycling centre in Stoke catches fire | Daily Mail Online

author: Simon Holmes For Mailonline
title: Huge fire at a recycling centre in Stoke catches fire | Daily Mail Online
text: comments Firefighters are hurrying to extinguish a huge fire that has broken out at a plastics recycling centre. Dramatic images show thick plumes of black smoke, which can be seen from four miles away, billowing out of the Hanbury Plastics centre in Milton, Stoke-on-Trent. The blaze broke out shortly after 9.30am this morning with the fire engine service subsequently receiving 78 calls in 10 minutes from concerned locals. Residents have been advised to stay indoors while Staffordshire Fire and Rescue attempt to control the flames and potentially toxic smoke. The fire service said the 60m x 100m building contains recycled plastics. It's not known whether anyone is inside. Photos have emerged on Twitter on thick smoke reaching high into the sky The smoke is thick it can be seen from four miles away Share or comment on this article Most watched News videos
